required_header.download_date: Information obtained from ClinicalTrials.gov on October 20, 2011
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of KB004 in Subjects With Hematologic Malignancies
clinical_study.official_title: Study of the Anti-EphA3 Monoclonal Antibody KB004 in Subjects With EphA3-Expressing Hematologic Malignancies

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine a maximum tolerated dose (MTD) for KB004 when administered once weekly by intravenous (IV) infusion to subjects with EphA3-expressing hematologic malignancies.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Non-Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Determine a possible maximum tolerated dose (MTD)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Once weekly for the first three weeks of study treatment
primary_outcome.description: Determination of a possible MTD as assessed by the number of subjects experiencing KB004-related adverse events that are considered dose limiting in nature

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed through weekly subject evaluations for the entire duration of study participation (up to 1 year)
secondary_outcome.description: Number of subjects with adverse events and laboratory abnormalities as a measure of safety and tolerability

secondary_outcome.time_frame: For Dosing Cycle 1: Baseline, at end of study drug administration & 1hr, 3hrs, 6 hrs, 2d, 3d, 5d, 8d, and 15d following study drug administration. Thereafter Day 1 of Dosing Cycles 2, 3, 6, 9, 12 & 15 (Dosing Cycles each @ 3wks)
secondary_outcome.description: The amount of KB004 in subject serum over time as a measure of its pharmacokinetic profile

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacodynamic effects on relevant tumor cell subpopulations
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Day 1 of Dosing Cycles 2 (optional), 3, 6, 9, 12, and 15
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in the amount of EphA3-expressing tumor cells by subpopulation in subject blood or bone marrow

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Day 8, and Day 15 of Dosing Cycle 1 and Day 1 of Dosing Cycles 2, 3, 6, 9, 12, and 15
secondary_outcome.description: The development of anti-KB004 antibodies in subject blood as a measure of immunogenicity

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Day 1 of Dosing Cycles 2 (optional), 3, 6, 9, 12, and 15
secondary_outcome.description: The number of subject with reduced hematologic malignancy signs and symptoms as a measure of clinical activity

arm_group.description: IV infusion 1x Weekly for a 21 day dosing cycle Up to 17 cycles at 4 planned dose levels
IV infusion 1x Weekly for a 21 day dosing cycle Up to 17 cycles at 4 planned dose levels
IV infusion 1x Weekly for a 21 day dosing cycle Up to 17 cycles at 4 planned dose levels
IV infusion 1x Weekly for a 21 day dosing cycle Up to 17 cycles at 4 planned dose levels

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Confirmed hematologic malignancy, including Acute Myeloid Leukemia (AML), Chronic Myelogenous Leukemia (CML), Acute Lymphocytic Leukemia (ALL), Myelodysplastic Syndrome (MDS), Myeloproliferative Neoplasms (MPN)
- EphA3 expression
- Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) â‰¤2
- Acceptable laboratory results
- Corrected QT-Bazett's formula (QTcB) <0.48 seconds
- Acceptable level of residual toxicity from prior therapy
- No standard therapies available
Exclusion Criteria:
- Active central nervous system (CNS) involvement due to leukemia
- Recent major surgery
- Ongoing surgical or wound healing complications
- History of bleeding diathesis
- Uncontrolled hypertension
- Significant intercurrent illness
- Pregnant or breastfeeding women
- Unable or unwilling to provide written informed consent
